content.webTitle: Cricket: County Championship guide First Division – Worcestershire

fields.headline: County Championship preview: Worcestershire
fields.bodyText: Big year for Simon Jones His fitness will be crucial after a third knee operation as will the runs of Stephen Moore In a nutshell Graeme Hick-less for the first time in 25 summers, Worcestershire's priority is to stay up after their two previous promotions were both followed by instant relegation Ashes factor Queensland's Ashley Noffke could be in prime position should one of Australia's front-line seamers break down. He knows how to bowl in England too: this will be his fourth county Foreign flavour Look out for the teenage Dutchman Alexei Kervezee, who made 47 on his ODI debut against Sri Lanka three years ago and has been described by former Essex all-rounder Keith Pont, the Netherlands' bowling coach, as having "shades of Graeme Hick" Well I never Gareth Batty is indebted to the former England captain, Michael Vaughan, who alerted lifeguards to rescue him from drowning while surfing in Galle in 2003 Lawrence Booth Bob Willis's verdict This season will be a struggle for the other promoted team. Steve Rhodes' side doesn't have the strength or depth to compete and I predict they will go straight back down Captain Vikram Solanki Director of cricket Steve Rhodes 2008: Championship 2nd (Div 2) Pro40 7th (Div 1) Friends Provident Trophy 3rd in South-West Division Twenty20 Cup 5th in Midlands/West/Wales Division In Ian Fisher (Glo), Imran Arif Out Graeme Hick (retired) Overseas Ashley Noffke (Aus)
